title: How to Make Grapefruit Sorbet

steps.headline: Clean 3 large pink grapefruits, then using a zester tool or food grater, grate the rind off 1 of the grapefruit and set aside.
Combine 1 cup of sugar and 1 cup of water over medium heat.
steps.description: Stir until the sugar is dissolved.

steps.headline: Bring sugar water to a boil without stirring for 1 to 2 minutes, then reduce heat and simmer for 5 more minutes.
Slice the grapefruit in half and squeeze out the juice into a mixing bowl.
steps.description: You should get 2 cups of juice. Use a sieve or a strainer to remove any pulp from the juice.

steps.headline: Fill a large mixing bowl with ice cubes and then set another mixing bowl on top of the ice.
steps.description: This will help cool the liquid faster and speed up the preparation time.

steps.headline: Remove saucepan from heat and pour sugar syrup into the top mixing bowl.
steps.description: Add 1 tbs of lemon juice, the grated zest, and the 2 cups of grapefruit juice. Mix Well.

steps.headline: Decide what chilling method you wish to use.
steps.description: Transfer contents to a covered container and freeze until ready to serve.

methods.name: Use a plastic container and pour the liquid contents into. Chill until semi-solid (approximately 1 hour).

steps.headline: Preparation.
steps.description: Use a fork to scrap the treat into a mashed consistency, put back in the freezer to finish freezing process. Place fully frozen contents into food processor or blender and mix until smooth. Refreeze until ready to serve.

steps.headline: Scoop up 1/2 cup servings in individual dishes.

text: Steps Clean 3 large pink grapefruits, then using a zester tool or food grater, grate the rind off 1 of the grapefruit and set aside.  Combine 1 cup of sugar and 1 cup of water over medium heat. Stir until the sugar is dissolved. Bring sugar water to a boil without stirring for 1 to 2 minutes, then reduce heat and simmer for 5 more minutes.  Slice the grapefruit in half and squeeze out the juice into a mixing bowl. You should get 2 cups of juice. Use a sieve or a strainer to remove any pulp from the juice. Fill a large mixing bowl with ice cubes and then set another mixing bowl on top of the ice. This will help cool the liquid faster and speed up the preparation time. Remove saucepan from heat and pour sugar syrup into the top mixing bowl. Add 1 tbs of lemon juice, the grated zest, and the 2 cups of grapefruit juice. Mix Well. Decide what chilling method you wish to use. Transfer contents to a covered container and freeze until ready to serve. Use a plastic container and pour the liquid contents into. Chill until semi-solid (approximately 1 hour). Preparation. Use a fork to scrap the treat into a mashed consistency, put back in the freezer to finish freezing process. Place fully frozen contents into food processor or blender and mix until smooth. Refreeze until ready to serve. Scoop up 1/2 cup servings in individual dishes.
